name: BEST WESTERN Lorne Coachman Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived in Lorne during our honeymoon roadtrip. Not having booked any hotels in advance, we checked out the Best Western.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were pleasantly surprised when they had rooms available for AUD 99. (I think the rates in high season may well be over AUD 200!)
reviews.title: A good night's rest!

reviews.text: The room itself looked like a four star hotel room and was very clean. It had a kitchenette with fridge and microwave and free movies on the TV. The prices for drinks in the fridge were incredibly cheap - around AUD 15 for a bottle of wine! - probably no dearer than the supermarkets. The bathroom had a large shower, sink and toilet, but er no bath! I think the rooms were upgraded sometime during 2006.
reviews.title: Not bad

likes.liked: — Free digital tv and in house movies.
likes.disliked: — Entry into car park is tight.

reviews.title: Forget it!
reviews.text: Contrary to another review of this hotel, I found the guy on reception to be very friendly and helpful. He even offered advice on which routes to take when driving back to Melbourne. It may well have been a different person though!

description: Best Western Lorne Coachman Inn. AAA certified & rated means you know what standard to expect. Stay at this centrally located Lorne motel, close to the beautiful forests of the Great Otway National Park and the dramatic scenery of the Great Ocean Road. The Best Western Lorne Coachman Inn offers 3.5 star accommodation in Lorne, Victoria. All rooms have kitchenettes, air conditioning, Foxtel cable TV and wireless broadband Internet access FREE to guests. There are also four spa rooms. Other facilities at this Lorne motel include a relaxing BBQ area and complimentary off-street car parking. Try our delicious, home-cooked breakfasts during your stay. The Best Western Lorne Coachman Inn is close to a variety of local attractions and activities, such as beaches, surfing, fishing, native forest bushwalks and waterfalls. Or, if you are not into the outdoors, indulge in some retail therapy and enjoy the town’s many restaurants and cafes.
